009package imagingbook.common.geometry.line;
010
011
012import java.util.Locale;
013
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
015
016/**
017 * This class represents a straight line in Hessian normal form, i.e., 
018 * x * cos(angle) + y * sin(angle) = radius.
019 * It is merely a subclass of {@link AlgebraicLine} with a different constructor
020 * and getter methods for angle and radius.
021 * Instances are immutable. Reference point is (0,0).
022 */
023public class HessianLine extends AlgebraicLine {
024        
025        // static factory methods ----------------------------------------
026        
027        public static HessianLine from(Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2) {
028                return new HessianLine(AlgebraicLine.from(p1, p2));
029        }
030        
031        // constructors --------------------------------------------------
032
033        /**
034         * Constructor. Creates a new {@link HessianLine} instance with the
035         * specified angle and radius.
036         * Note that this really creates a normalized {@link AlgebraicLine}.
037         * The values returned by {@link #getAngle()} and {@link #getRadius()}
038         * may not be identical to the values passed to this constructor.
039         * 
040         * @param angle the line's angle
041         * @param radius the line's radius
042         */
043        public HessianLine(double angle, double radius) {
044                super(Math.cos(angle), Math.sin(angle), -radius);       // = A, B, C
045        }
046        
047        public HessianLine(double a, double b, double c) {
048                super(a, b, c);                 // creates a normalized line
049        }
050        
051        public HessianLine(AlgebraicLine al) {
052                super(al.getParameters());
053        }
054        
055        public double getAngle() {
056                return Math.atan2(B, A);
057        }
058        
059        public double getRadius() {
060                return -C;
061        }
062        
063        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
064        
065        @Override
066        public String toString() {
067                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <angle = %.3f, radius = %.3f>",
068                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), getAngle(), getRadius());
069        }
070
071}
